fr.umlv.wallj.bomb

Class Explosion

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.umlv.wallj.bomb.Explosion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Displayable, org.jbox2d.callbacks.RayCastCallback

    public class Explosion
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.jbox2d.callbacks.RayCastCallback, Displayable
    Represents an Explosion of a Bomb. An explosion is represented by severals rays, each going in a different direction. It implements JBox2D's RayCastCallback interface, thus we can use reportFixture in the world.rayCast() method. The Position field represents the position of the center of the Explosion. It's the position of the body of the Bomb, and is the position on the application window. The rayNumber field is the number of rays fired by the bomb. This is then the number of rayCast for each Bomb. The endList field is the list of all the positions of the end of the rays, the start being the position of the explosion.
    Author:
    SÃ©verin Gosset - Denis Biguenet

    • Constructor Detail

      • Explosion

        public Explosion(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position,
                 int rayNumber)
        Create a new explosion, with the given position and number of rays. The endList of the explosion is created in order to have rays in circle around the explosion.
        Parameters:
        position - the posiotion of the center of the Bomb.
        rayNumber - the number of rays of the bomb.

    • Method Detail

      • reportFixture

        public float reportFixture(org.jbox2d.dynamics.Fixture fixture,
                           org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 point,
                           org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 normal,
                           float fraction)
        The methode used by world.rayCast. It allows to treat each fixture hit by the ray, and to apply a linear impulse to it (if it must be affected by the explsion), in order to make the garbage move.
        Specified by:
        reportFixture in interface org.jbox2d.callbacks.RayCastCallback
        Parameters:
        fixture - the fixture hit by the ray.
        point - the point of the fixture hit.
        normal - the side of the fixture hit.
        fraction - the fraction of the length of the ray which has hit the fixture. It's used to know the force to apply to the fixture.

      • getEndList

        public java.util.ArrayList<org.jbox2d.common.Vec2> getEndList()
        returns the endList of the explosion.
        Returns:
        the endlist.

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics)
        Draws the explosion in the given graphic context. An explosion is represented by rayNumber rays in circle around the center of the explosion.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Displayable
        Parameters:
        graphics - the graphic context in which draw the explosion.
